channel.title: Depressing
channel.description:
Something that really depresses me is when i see a 'ghost forums' in which someone has not posted in for about a year.
Example: http://bubbyscape69.smfforfree3.com/index.php (My old favorite server, you can still see my posts there xD [[url=http://bubbyscape69.smfforfree3.com/index.php/topic,247.msg1522.html#msg1522]i was 9 :([/url]])
What depresses you moparfags?

What depresses me is the amount of pure idiocy in this world that causes people to turn to such bullshit as religion.
[/quote]
Don’t start it back up…[/quote]

Start what, I’m posting on topic, you don’t have to reply to my post, it seems you’re the one starting something.

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:115, topic:326764”]this should be archived although for the hilarity of posts, though i’d just like to mention to jamie:
you can say that, in a way, i am mocking them, but more or less making a point. with the recent occurrences throughout 0-2010 i thought you’d realize that shit happens. i choose not to be sensitive now and humour it later, i humour it now because i can, whoever decides when some tragic thing can be funny can die in a fire.

anyway, what depresses me is technology advances too quickly for my wallet.[/quote]
Wow.

Read full topic

item.description:

you can say that, in a way, i am mocking them, but more or less making a point. with the recent occurrences throughout 0-2010 i thought you’d realize that shit happens. i choose not to be sensitive now and humour it later, i humour it now because i can, whoever decides when some tragic thing can be funny can die in a fire.

anyway, what depresses me is technology advances too quickly for my wallet.

it seems you are mocking those who need. i don’t think it’s particually humerous that we are joking about those who aren’t as fortunate as ourselves, with the recent earthquake and happenings around the world, i though maybe you’d all be a little more sensitive on the topic.

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:109, topic:326764”]Wait, how was that an inaccurate representation of your argument when i skimmed through everything you posted and summarized it?

also note that reputation is …your reputation on this community, it’s not sad that people derep you because they don’t like what you say.

okay so that’s basically the end of the argument then… since you don’t have anything factual.[/quote]
Because you said all of them were things I supported, when that is not true.

Okie dokie.

Do you?

Read full topic

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Wait, how was that an inaccurate representation of your argument when i skimmed through everything you posted and summarized it?

also note that reputation is …your reputation on this community, it’s not sad that people derep you because they don’t like what you say.

okay so that’s basically the end of the argument then… since you don’t have anything factual. it was funny while it lasted.

note that you’ve only specified ‘many’ (including blind being able to see, limbs regrown, etc.) occurrences in africa, i don’t see why there wouldn’t be any proof in this day in age regardless of it happening there, or here.

Read full topic

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That I have stated the fact no one can convince the other of their beliefs and this argument is still going on is sad. The fact that I got rep-- 4X for stating my beliefs is even more sad.

@The Soul - I agree with you 100%.

@Uriko - I will respond again by paragraphs.

  1. The Bible says that healing requires a patient, and a healer (sometimes the Holy Spirit, not a person).

  2. That is somewhat true. You will never see it for yourself if you do not believe it can happen.

  3. It was such an inaccurate representation of my argument I did not fell a need to respond.

  4. Healers are missionaries, but missionaries are not always healers.

  5. Did I ever once say that everyone is healed? My grandma on my dads side was predicted to live for two more weeks, and 3 years later she is still alive. Doctors call it a miracle. Are you saying you have never heard of something like that? And my grandpa on my moms side had a stroke, and died later.

Read full topic

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:101, topic:326764”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=423172.msg3110921#msg3110921 date=1264539030]

I do not need proof, and any proof you have that limbs do not grow back on their own, is true, but does not mean that an all powerful being cannot do it.

Limbs can grow back in certain species of lizards, however if there was a miracle most likely it would be at least covered to an extent by the media that at least one newspaper article or piece of proof could be found?

In the remote villages in Africa, probably not. If you really wanted to figure it out you could visit someone with a first hand account.
[/quote]If someone had mysteriously regrown their limb, you think just because it’s in a remote area outside of social reach it won’t get published? Assuming you’re well behind your religious beliefs I would expect you to know that missionaries always bring cameras with them to document nearly everything.[/quote]Yeah, sorry mate but you’re wrong. There’s no point in trying to convince us that what you say is true, because you don’t have any proof, whatsoever, and furthermore, there’s never been proof of this, ever.

Also, show us proof that they actually need these magical missionary healers, unless you’re just talking out of your ass, right? You must’ve got this information from somewhere. And if you say from your relatives…

You said that my uncle never seen it in Africa because he never believed in it… what? So you’re saying that people can regrow limbs, but if you don’t believe in God then you don’t see or will never hear anything about those people whom magically regrew their limbs.

Did you like my summation of your argument? Because clearly you have nothing to say about that.

You were talking about healers and missionaries and all that bullshit, and Reaper said they bring cameras to document this stuff, but according to the all knowing you, they don’t? (ps. you said yourself ‘healers’ ARE missionaries)

“If you have faith, then you DO see what happens. You follow your faith even though you have seen it for real. You confirm your faith.”
Let me tell you, you’re stepping a very fine line here, faggot. My grandma has Alzheimer’s (a non-reversible deteriorating disease) along with heart problems, she’s the biggest Catholic advocate I’ve ever seen, she wakes up, she prays, during the day, she prays, at any time, she prays. Explain to me why she hasn’t been cured of anything? Her faith is considerably bigger than some fucking Africans faith that wants to get better and go fuck some more to spread aids. [obviously i’m stretching this harshly, but apparently everyone in africa can regrow their limbs if they want]

edit: I seriously thought you’d be done after what everyone posted when you took your hiatus, but nope, you keep coming back with more… nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:103, topic:326764”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=423172.msg3110927#msg3110927 date=1264539488]

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=423172.msg3110924#msg3110924 date=1264539239]

I do not need proof, and any proof you have that limbs do not grow back on their own, is true, but does not mean that an all powerful being cannot do it.

Limbs can grow back in certain species of lizards, however if there was a miracle most likely it would be at least covered to an extent by the media that at least one newspaper article or piece of proof could be found?

In the remote villages in Africa, probably not. If you really wanted to figure it out you could visit someone with a first hand account.
[/quote]If someone had mysteriously regrown their limb, you think just because it’s in a remote area outside of social reach it won’t get published? Assuming you’re well behind your religious beliefs I would expect you to know that missionaries always bring cameras with them to document nearly everything.

Let me try to make this clearer.

God heals the faithful.

Faith is believing without seeing.
[/quote]We understand that you believe without seeing. I’m just trying to explain how ridiculous it sounds. No documentation? That’s merely unprofessional.[/quote]

But it depends on your view on the matter (the matter itself makes a difference as well). Even though things (of the supernatural or not) can be scientifically proven, it may not change the way one may see things because of their strong faith in what they believe in.

Anyways, I think we’re getting a tad off topic here…

Read full topic

item.title: Depressing
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:102, topic:326764”]Let me try to make this clearer.

God heals the faithful.

Faith is believing without seeing.[/quote]
i think his point is that there are millions of faithful people on earth, it so why hasn’t it occurred firstly, and secondly if it has occurred why is there no proof.

Btw man, i agree with you that faith is believing without seeing.

spent a few minuted googling it and it looks like it would be possible.

HowStuffWorks – 21 Feb 07

Can humans regrow fingers?

Can humans regrow fingers? Fetuses can regrow almost anything that gets damaged while in the womb. But can adult humans can regrow fingers?

Read full topic

This is why there are so many Christians.
